website_summaries.verdict: This rugged machine offers impressive power for a battery-operated model – enough to tackle most yards without running out of power.
pros: Brushless motor makes it powerful enough to trim large yards
Reasonably quiet to use with minimal vibration
Offers long battery life, plus it doesn't take too long to recharge
Has a solid build and 14-inch cut path
Comes with a battery and charger
cons: Heavier than other models we considered
Some owners had minor difficulties restringing it

customer_reviews.title: Cant replace string!
customer_reviews.text: This product works great on a small yard until you run out of string. It is simply impossible to put new string into the head. I even took it to a professional and they had no luck with adding string either. Instructions do not work nothing you try works. It's just it is a very poor design on the head. Which is unfortunate as I think the product would be excellent if it weren't for the string replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Complete lack of customer support
customer_reviews.text: The trimmer is fine. My issue is with customer support. There isn’t any. I have tried emailing multiple times, tweeting direct messages, tweeting public messages, all multiple times. Never a single response. I am questioning the purchase of all of my Greenworks tools now, and I have many. I simply cannot recommend them at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: BATTERY NOT WORTH A CRAP!
customer_reviews.text: WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER! The battery will not hold a charge after not being used for a few months. Tried to reorder the battery. They can’t figure it out even after giving them the model number and serial number. They can only give the price. I hung up and went to Lowe’s and bought a new trimmer, came home and threw the GreenWorks POS in the trash. Don’t waste your time and money on this “toy”. Pay a few extra dollars and get a real trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Tematua

customer_reviews.title: DON'T EVEN THINK OF IT!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I used it a total of 5 times, and the battery just died. Wouldn't recharge. I tried to order a new battery from Amazon, and with my fancy-dancey Prime, Amazon wouldn't ship me the lithium battery that I needed. Went to a Home Depot, who carries it, to get a new battery. The guy told me it is a piece of (guess) and wouldn't recommend it. "You get what you pay for". Don't anybody fall for it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Aome

customer_reviews.title: It’s a little heavy you must use a shoulder strap
customer_reviews.text: Great battery life It’s a little heavy and it’s a little hard to see exactly where the string is in the cutting mode But the housing around it really protects you from not getting hit with any flying debris that you might be cutting The feeder works great what really saves anyone from using this is the shoulder strap want it adjusted properly it really makes the use of this device almost perfect You can also put attachments on to it and it does a great job when cutting
customer_reviews.author: TERESA T

customer_reviews.title: Great product but not so great customer service from Greenworks
customer_reviews.text: The product is great but I had an issue with a 3rd party edger attachment and it would periodically beep twice and shut down while edging. I filled out a contact form asking Greenworks what this was all about and it took me over a month to get an answer and I'm still waiting on a follow up reply. Turns out that there was nothing wrong with the unit it just shuts down if you push the edger faster than the system is designed for. I just slowed down and it works great. The string trimmer is excellent and it quick to load. Best of all when you tap the head for more string it works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: William Hull

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: I've had this tool for three summers now and the only thing I have had to replace is of course the string. I got the 4.0 battery and I love it! I have a fairly decent size yard that is too rustic to use a lawn mower. This tool works great for different types of grass and weeds. I'm only 5feet tall and 85lbs, this is light enough for me to us all day. Depending on the thickness of the grass, the battery goes at least an hour before needing to charge. I love the convenience of low maintenance (don't need my husband's help to maintenance it!) and not smelling gas the whole time I'm weed whipping.
customer_reviews.author: Mom from Minnesota

customer_reviews.title: Great combo pack& very powerful! Get at least 2 batteries & chargers. They last long but I have
customer_reviews.text: I am 76 years old & own several properties & have done much of the yard maintenance myself. Had an injury to my right shoulder so could not crank the starter cord. Had used some 20 V weed eater before ok for minor work but not big jobs. Finally decided to try the combo 40V weedeater, blower & tree trimmer plus 2 additional batteries & chargers. This is a great combo & as powerful as my gas units. Now I am back to work & one happy Mainteance man. Little expensive but worth every penny spent! Get one you won’t be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: John Lacrosse

customer_reviews.title: Greenworks 40w 4 Ah 14 in trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Really happy so far. Battery took about 2.5 hours for first charge but lasted over an hour in use. Recommend having a spare with larger yards, which I purchased. I am 5’6” and 70 year old woman and it was not difficult for me to use this trimmer. Very glad I went battery power after all previous trimmers being gas. Appears well made and I chose based on several reviews for 2019 in which this trimmer model popped at or near top. Impressed how much quieter than all previous gas trimmers. Still have not had to bump feed after over an hour of heavy cutting of green grasses and vines that were 18-36 in tall! Impressed.
customer_reviews.author: VeldaWalks

customer_reviews.title: More powerful than expected
customer_reviews.text: I decided to give the Greenworks trimmer a try since I seemed to be jinxed with 2 cycle gas trimmers. I live in a rural area and have a large yard. The battery lasted longer than I expected but not nearly enough to complete the entire yard. I'll add a second battery and that should cover just about anything I'd ever want to do. It is quiet and doesn't get hot like a gas powered trimmer. It has trimmed everything I've tried so far without much difficulty. It comes with a shoulder strap that is adequate. It's early yet, but so far I've been very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfpack83

customer_reviews.title: Great weedeater!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the product, battery charges quickly, I get an hour of usage (even with tough fescue grass here in the Midwest), I threw out the head that came with it and installed the head from my old gas powered one, as I prefer the pre-cut thick strings I can slip in real quick on the go. Don't throw away the shoulder strap, you will need it. Your choice of power settings, and a juice-meter on the battery, very happy overall and would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Illinois guy

customer_reviews.title: Missing Parts
customer_reviews.text: Never got to use it because it was missing parts, and I was told by Greenworks that it would take 7 to 14 business days for them to send me replacement parts. You would think that since it was their fault, that that would overnight it. Oh well, such is life
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: This trimmer works just as good as any gas ones I have had before, but its super heavy!
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer works just as good as any gas ones I have had before, but its super heavy! My back is killing me at 6' tall just after 15 mins use. Also, the battery does not last that long. Another thing to note, if you are tall, you are going to find yourself hunched forward to use it, as you cannot adjust the length of the pole. Overall, I like using the new battery technology, however when it comes to this one, it gets the job done, but your back will hurt and you may not finish the job up based on battery life. I suggest you have another tool with an additional battery.
customer_reviews.author: MissingLink

customer_reviews.title: Really good at whirling grass around in a circle
customer_reviews.text: If you have grass that's longer than about 10 inches, you'll spend as much time unwinding tangled grass from the head as you do cutting the grass. Even then, a lot of the grass doesn't get cut, it just gets swirled into a spiral that has to have several more passes done on it. I have the low end, cheap Greenworks string trimmer from years ago that worked better than this one - too bad I can't get parts for it!
customer_reviews.author: Obnubilated

customer_reviews.title: I will never go back to gas
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to get an electric weed eater. I will say, I'm very pleased with this unit. I will never go back to cranking on a gas weedeater again. Has as much and I would actually say more power than the gas weedeaters I've used. Much more quiet. Runs long enough that I am tired of weedeating long before the battery goes dead. The two speed options on the weedeater are great in terms of saving battery life and increasing runtime. Overall a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Great product, near ZERO carbon footprint. Uses NO dirty gas!!
customer_reviews.text: The power of this unit is amazing. The 40volt 4amp battery is UNBELIEVABLE! I did buy an additional 4volt 2amp battery as a backup! Hardly used it yet! The unit feels a bit top heavy at first with the batteru being the majority of the weight and on top. HOWEVER; the unit comes with a cross shoulder strap to take the weight off your hands and back. Took a little trial and error, but I am using it with ease and very little effort!!
customer_reviews.author: MS65

customer_reviews.title: better than my old gas powered weed eater straight shaft ...
customer_reviews.text: Very strong unit. better than my old gas powered weed eater straight shaft that died after less than two years. This unit does my two lawns no problem juice to spare with no fumes, oil, or gas, needed. I love it. the only con is it is heavier than the old gas unit. It challenges the forearms a bit. I guess i should use the harness that comes with it. I like the workout but probably not for slight of build.
customer_reviews.author: Stinger

customer_reviews.title: Zero Support - Replacement Parts Unavailable
customer_reviews.text: The bump head on this trimmer wore out. I left a question on a replacement in the questions here (which somehow vanished) and Greenworks responded that I should contact them thorough their website, which I did. Still waiting for a response TWO MONTHS LATER! I have 4 expensive Greenworks yard tools and I'm wondering which one will break next and have no available replacement parts.
customer_reviews.author: M Nobleman

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy trimmer
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer is well made. Attachments are easy to slip on and off. Power is significant, too. And, the trimmer is easy to use. The one drawback is that the trimmer is quite heavy. Thank the designer because there is a strap for your shoulder that helps diffuse the heaviness. Perhaps, aluminum shafts would help?
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Gintoft

customer_reviews.title: works a lot better than gmax line
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the gmax version. The gmax had auto feed and would not auto feed line so I had to continuously pull the line feed cover off and do it manually. This unit is a tap feed and works as expected. It also has changeable attachments, albeit, not too impressed with the edger since this unit kept shutting down every few inches due to not enough power to eat through tough edging of lawn.
customer_reviews.author: SocialDragonfly

customer_reviews.title: Good power and buyer beware on packaging
customer_reviews.text: Pros Battery life is good for 40 volt 4 mah, get the 4 mah Pretty powerful trimmer So glad I settled on this brand since I have all attachments, Ryobi, Craftsman, Troy bilt. All will work as long as you have the square drive shaft. Cons Seller does not state that the unit is new in description. Pic shows the box with a lot of taping. Might be a refurb but not quite sure beware. The product is a very good one and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nousaw

customer_reviews.title: IF you don't mind a heavier trimmer, use the 4ah battery and it may give you 30-40 mins
customer_reviews.text: Good trimmer but its a bit unweildy for even this 6 foot 240 lb man to handle for exrensive trimming of grass--even with a shoulder strap, its a very heavy tool to lug around and I found the 12 inch with the auto feeding line to be much eaier to use as well as liking the simple non bump feed trimmer line----- the bump feed may appeal ro more professional grass cutters but I find it causes me to waste cord and it bangs my brick walkways and pavers-needs the 4ah battery if your gonna get unit..
customer_reviews.author: UnimPeachable

customer_reviews.title: So Far, So Good!
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight compared to my gas trimmer! Impressed with the power even though I have not had much of a chance to use (purchased in late fall). I have attachment to use as a tiller and brush cutter, so I hope to be able to utilize these without the extra weight and inconvenience of putting gas and oil in my 4 cycle.
customer_reviews.author: Richard J Solomon Sr

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING! I have a rather large yard
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING! I have a rather large yard, and the battery lasts for all of my needs. I have edged my garden, and have used this to take out all the grass around my pine trees. This thing just doesn't quit! Battery charge time is a little long, but you'll find that with batteries this size. I will be purchasing a secondary battery at some point, but I don't really need one quite yet. If you plan on purchasing other greenwork items spend the extra money and get the battery with the machine.
customer_reviews.author: C. Klintworth

customer_reviews.title: Issues with Amazon not Greenworks
customer_reviews.text: I just wanted to make sure that no one else makes the same mistake I did. I watched the video halfway down the page and in it they state that the Brush Cutter Attachment is included. After receiving the item I saw that it did not include this attachment, which was the primary reason for purchasing this specific, slightly more expensive String Trimmer. After checking the item page I noticed that there are two near identical videos one which states that the Brush Cutter Attachment is included and one that states it is not included. Frustrating that I now either have to deal with returning the item or I just have to suck it up and purchase the item now.
customer_reviews.author: T. L. Bieritz

customer_reviews.title: The battery does make it a little heavier than I'd like, but still nothing like a gas one
customer_reviews.text: Pleasantly surprised! This weed-eater has a lot of power not to run off gas. The battery does make it a little heavier than I'd like, but still nothing like a gas one. I've used a couple of times so far and the battery holds it's charge well. I like the strap that comes with it to help support the unit while in use. I just snap the strap across my shoulder/chest area. I look forward to years of yard work with this one! Good quality and happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Littlecreek115

customer_reviews.title: Very glad I bought  this
customer_reviews.text: It's a bit on the heavy side for us older folk, but not bad. Easiest string change I've ever experienced on a trimmer. Highly recommended. I have the blower as well and switch batteries as needed, one usually on the charger and the other in use.
customer_reviews.author: sckarolek

customer_reviews.title: nothing but headaches
customer_reviews.text: I have had this over a year and nothing but trouble.. line does not feed properly, difficult to replace, battery and charger are erratic.. only positive is that when it was working it did fit my stihl kombi tool replacements.. I did have high hopes for this tool, but I am ready to trash it in a year.... looking for a more reliable brand... I have been buying from amazon for over 20 years.. one of the few disappointments.. and I hate to trash a product... but this has earned it.
customer_reviews.author: Steven R. McGuire

customer_reviews.title: I wish I went battery powered a long time ago!
customer_reviews.text: Great battery powered trimmer. I just wish I jumped on this battery-powered bandwagon sooner! The weight is my only issue but they do provide a shoulder strap to offset but I don’t use it so it’s on me that the weight is an issue. Very quiet compared to gas powered models(if they start). I’ve since acquired the compatible 19” mower (SUPER Quiet) and blower! Hedger is next! All powered by 1 rechargeable battery! No more gas, oil, filters, belts, tune-ups or not knowing if the equipment will even start. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: LLIB-LLEB

customer_reviews.title: Slow, clunky, rickety and backwards.
customer_reviews.text: I have a few Greenworks tools and for the most part I like them. This one however is heavy, rickety and lacks power compared to an earlier Greenworks edger that I already own. I will have to give it some time, but at this point I only see it losing stars not gaining. Also the direction that the head spins is reverse to every other trimmer I have ever owned, so it feels weird and is harder for me to use.
customer_reviews.author: LyleRoberts

customer_reviews.title: Works good,
customer_reviews.text: Works good... we have a small yard so I can cut it with one battery and use the other battery with the 20' mower by the same brand. Its very, very quite which is great for early morning mowing without waking neighbors. I have had many compliments on how quite it is. Wish I would have gotten a larger blade width. Would only buy if you have a small yard.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Great trimmer
customer_reviews.text: This is a great trimmer. It has quite a bit of power and has cut everything I’ve tried so far. The only thing negative I have is that it’s heavy. It’s as heavy or heavier than most of my gas trimmers (Stihl and Husqvarna). But it has a wide cut and decent size trimmer line. I don’t really understand why it has an “On” switch on a battery powered tool (on switch then press safety switch then squeeze trigger). But all in all an awesome trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Nanntte H.

customer_reviews.title: Great while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: I used this weedeater less than 20 times over a 2 year period. It suddenly would not charge. The expense of another battery is not worth it. Evidently, the battery dies in 2 years regardless of usage. It worked great and I loved it but for me it was a waste of money in the big picture.
customer_reviews.author: Danny R Head

customer_reviews.title: A second battery is a requirement.
customer_reviews.text: Seems very solid, which translated to heavy. A second or two batteries are a must. If you consume the charge on a battery and recharge it a minutes use gets an alarm, and the machine quits. This happened on a 66F degree day.The next day it appears to ok. This is advertised as the "Pro" machine, it would have a second battery if it were intended for professional gardeners who work a full day.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick @ A2

customer_reviews.title: box came damaged
customer_reviews.text: this greenworks is replacing the one i had, could not get a cap for it, so i got a new one.my neighbor is putting it together for me. no tool came with it.the box was damaged, and it was not packaged, the way it should be, as everything was loose in the box, and the black handle was scratched. if my charger and two batteries, didn't work with my new one, i would have bought something else. not happy, the way i received it.it should've been put in a greeworks box, before they stuck in in a regular shipping box, everything was loose. i hope i got all my parts with it
customer_reviews.author: albert C.

customer_reviews.title: and bought it because it was recommended with chainsaw attachment
customer_reviews.text: Strong and powerful. No attachments available for this model.., at least not on Amazon that I can find...kind of a pisser. It is heavy, but the convenience make up for it. Probably overkill for what I need done, and bought it because it was recommended with chainsaw attachment...which is not compatible. Great product, I love Greenworks, but really do your research.
customer_reviews.author: Chef

customer_reviews.title: Really like their products and got this one as extra one
customer_reviews.text: This is 3rd weed whacker bought from greenworks. Really like their products and got this one as extra one, for hired helpers to use for my 3 acre back yard and 1/2 acre front yard. This is a powerful week whacker and works great, even on tough weeds that grow along our fence line.
customer_reviews.author: repatterson19

customer_reviews.title: Bye bye gas!
customer_reviews.text: Bye bye gas and frustration! Push one button to start and has more than enough juice to cleanup my property. The fuel line on my last string trimmer broke and leaked all down my leg, thankfully it didn't ignite. I'm fully on board with the g-max 40v system and plan on adding more tools tat are compatible with the battery packs. This unit is very smooth and is powerful to mow through anything I've come across. I highly recommend Greenworks tools and accessories!
customer_reviews.author: Kurt P.

customer_reviews.title: Worked so much better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Worked so much better than expected. I was fearful of line issues -- everyone I had would break and I would end up wanting to break unit in 2. The last one I had just had individual string which you inserted -- that worked well. Took a chance when that unit broke and got this one -- no noise, no spark-plug, no gas! And the line feed works just fine. Just make sure you buy right line and read instructions. It's simple but take time. I only replaced once and it's last summer. Good enough for me!
customer_reviews.author: Beatles

customer_reviews.title: Definitely do it again.
customer_reviews.text: For a homeowner I will never go back to gas again. Wouldn't work if you were a commercial operator because charging batteries is required after you run out of charge. But for a homeowner with your own yard this is a great product my kids especially my boy was reluctant to use the gas one and couldn't even use it most of the time. Now he's willing and able.
customer_reviews.author: David & Adrienne

customer_reviews.title: Does a very good job
customer_reviews.text: This is a great trimmer (the 14" V40 cordless) The battery so far has held up well and the power of the trimmer cuts thru the grass easily . I am very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Guitar Player

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: Much better product than I expected when I purchased it. Solid and sturdy. Very powerful. Has a strap to hang the weight, once it’s adjusted it’s very easy to hold. I’ve never managed to run the battery down using the same battery to trim and blow my yard
customer_reviews.author: freefly

customer_reviews.title: Good By 2cycl gas motors RIP
customer_reviews.text: Received my new string trimmer yesterday. Very powerful and great to use. No noise, no gas smell, no mixing gas. I used it this morning to trim lots of fence post and around the house. Had lots of power and still going strong. Out lasted me (of course I am 72) but neglected trimming due to poor performance of my gas trimmer. I cannot say enough about this trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Stearns

customer_reviews.title: Love it, less noise
customer_reviews.text: Love it, less noise, no gas, about the same in weight. I like the fact that it has a huge shroud on it which keeps grass from piling up my feet. I was able to do my whole yard on the 4amp battery with 2 bars showing. I purchased another 2amp battery just in case. I am actually pretty impressed and it was up to the job as my 4cycle which i am selling now. Yes it costs a little more but man was it worth it!!!! Bump feed works like a dream as well.
customer_reviews.author: steeda1974

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: After one use. I edged all my yard with the edger attachment. Worked as good or better than my gas edger. Seemed to have plenty of power left when I was done.
customer_reviews.author: Jaded

customer_reviews.title: "Cranks" every time
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic weed eater. Very powerful, great run time. I did however replace the bump-n-go head with one of those that takes the precut short pieces. The new head is lighter and gives the unit more torque.
customer_reviews.author: Andy from FL

customer_reviews.title: 40 Watt Cordless Weed trimmer
customer_reviews.text: We have an acre and a half and I can weed the entire area twice before changing batteries. This Trimmer has excellent cutting capabilities and I can interchange my tools such as an edger, Chain Saw, Hedge clippers, etc. - Love this Trimmer and hopefully, it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus W. Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic trimmer
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome trimmer. It is a bit heavy but, it will cut without effort and runs a long time on a single charge. If you adjust the strap correctly, the weight really isn't bad at all. I'd highly recommend this trimmer over anything you might find at your local hardware store.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price!  Your yard will look great!
customer_reviews.text: Can handle weeds and brush better than my old electric trimmer. Easy to assemble. After charging ran at top speed for over 3 hours until it needed another charge, which was as long as I could go. It's quite heavy so my arms get a good workout. The strap was just too awkward for me. The best part is how simple it is to restring! Glad I finally purchased this, makes yard work much easier.
customer_reviews.author: KJones

customer_reviews.title: Leaky, wobbly - an unsatisfying out-of-the-box experience.
customer_reviews.text: I was so discouraged by the leaking of blue oil all over my garage floor (see picture), that I haven't even used it. I did notice that the connection of the two parts of the pole was frustrating and cumbersome (and not very steady after tightening). I'm very happy with my OTHER Greenworks 40v-Max tools.
customer_reviews.author: J. F. Kelley, Ph.D.

customer_reviews.title: Great reliable trimmer
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer is a beast. It's actually quite heavy compared to many gas ones but it doesnt skinp on power. This thing cuts anything down I've thrown at it with ease. Some things gets tangle slightly around the end but a quick pause to untangle bigger weeds is easy and simple. I love this trimmer and dont know what I did without it.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight but packs a punch.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very handy blower and much lighter than our old one. You can run the battery out if you run it on high for awhile but it charges up quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Pittman

customer_reviews.title: String trimmer worked as anticipated
customer_reviews.text: The purchased string trimmer worked as anticipated. I did not run long enough to exhaust the battery. I like the fact the battery is interchangeable with other tools.
customer_reviews.author: PK

customer_reviews.title: Great power!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome power. Easy to use once you figure out how to reload the trimmer. (See product website). It is quite heavy, a trade off for battery life and power.
customer_reviews.author: E. Nakamura

customer_reviews.title: great trimmer
customer_reviews.text: trimmer works better then expected, Able to trim around the whole yard including edging the driveway and sidewalk with plenty of battery life left. The string advance works well with just a slight bump on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: will

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and practical
customer_reviews.text: Powerful tool with long lasting battery without the smell of gas and the hassle. I have several Greenworks tools and I wish I bought this one sooner. I also bought the cultivator attachment, very practical tool I used to prep the soil before reseeding.
customer_reviews.author: J. Younes

customer_reviews.title: Great trimmer. I don't have a large lawn but ...
customer_reviews.text: Great trimmer. I don't have a large lawn but it did the job. My neigbor was hospitalized and left her lawn go- I used the trimmer to cut back the high grass then mowed it! I would recommend this to most people. Not sure how long the run time is since I don't have a huge lawn.Next up-looking at the blower. -If greenworks wants to send me one to test.....
customer_reviews.author: KW

customer_reviews.title: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: Wow. I decided to compromise and give up the power of internal combustion engines for my lawn equipment for this battery powered unit. Turned out not to be a compromise! It works as well or better than my gas unit. And it is so much more convenient to use, I find myself using it much more than my old unit. Five stars! I think battery technology has finally arrived at a point to make these machines just as good as gas.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great so far! I only use it lightly becuase I have a push mower for the rest of the lawn but this along with the edger attachment work perfect. Battery is 40V so be careful how you use it and save enough for the edges
customer_reviews.author: Edmond

customer_reviews.title: Works surprisingly well
customer_reviews.text: From the box to trimming weeds only took ten minutes or less with very easy setup. Trimmer works best when in turbo mode but this runs the battery down quicker. I kept the turbo mode on while trimming and the battery lasted about 20 minutes of run time. This trimmer is now my go to trimmer. No mess and plenty of power. I also have the greenworks Gmax 16 inch chainsaw with 4 ah battery and the batteries are interchangeable between the two products.
customer_reviews.author: Farmer Eric

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality! Can't beat the battery life compared to others
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to match all my other green works products. Does it's job very well. Quality piece of equipment. A bit on the heavy side compared to other battery powered units because I use a 4.0a battery but it comes with a shoulder harness so not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazing Stuff LLC

customer_reviews.title: So much easier with no compromises!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is so cool! Super legit, eats through any weeds, isn't nearly as loud or obnoxious or as hard to start as a regular gas powered. All the power, none of the hassle! No choke, primer, gas mixture, etc...So much easier with no compromises!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Fellure

customer_reviews.title: Some days it works a good 20-30 minutes before losing charge
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Either the battery or the trimmer itself is a little wonky sometimes. Some days it works a good 20-30 minutes before losing charge, other days it starts beeping like it's out of power after a few seconds. I find that remounting the battery sometimes helps.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! No more mixing gas with oil or cursing when I pull and pull the starter cord but nothing happens. I like the way the line gets installed in one piece as well as the way it feeds with a little tap. It is heavy but I enjoy the work out.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Smith

customer_reviews.title: Lots of Power!
customer_reviews.text: Replaced old John Deere gas unit. Have run following attachments (4AH): Tiller (~30min), Pole Saw (>30min), Brush Cutter (>30min), Hedge Trimmer (>30min), and Included String Timmer (>45min). Had occasional "overloads" with Brush (small trees), Hedge (branches > 3/8"), Pole Saw (only when pinched by large branches) - every time it recovered instantly when trigger released and re-pressed. Slower to spin up than gas, but you get used to it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy and unwieldy!
customer_reviews.text: We have several Green Works tools but this trimmer is not usable by my wife. It is too heavy and unwieldy but it cuts grass.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Great trimmer, worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Used to buy the cheaper Worx one, it won't last for more than an year. Saw the good reviews for Greenworks and decided to try. Very satisfied after one season, solid quality. Only downside is it is a little heavy.
customer_reviews.author: X. WEI

customer_reviews.title: Line spool housing seized
customer_reviews.text: The line spool housing tightened to the point it will not rotate. Something has basically seized after a little more than a month of weekly residential use. The cover and line spool come off, but I am unable to loosen the housing that screws onto the shaft, or even loosen it to allow it to freely rotate. Frustrating...
customer_reviews.author: Surfer Girl

customer_reviews.title: Good Trimmer, but...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast. I think I might have been able to get by just fine with the next smaller model, but this certainly does the job. I'm mowing a small, 1/4 acre lot and I think this size might be overkill. It would be perfect for someone who has to mow a larger area with a lot of trim work.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.B

customer_reviews.title: Not bad at all
customer_reviews.text: So far works really well, actually as good or better than the gas it replaced. Did put edger attachment on it from old trimmer as it says they fit but had a hard time with edging but overall I am happy. Got blower with it too and it is great
customer_reviews.author: Todd S.

customer_reviews.title: It works well but is quite heavy
customer_reviews.text: Has power to do job. It is a little heavy. Shoulder strap needs some work.
customer_reviews.author: daylily

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful
customer_reviews.text: Using this trimmer for cleaning out grass under fence, around bushes, trees and edge of yard. It's very power full (more than my expectation). I cannot compare it with gas or cord trimmer, because it's the first trimmer I have. Usually cleaning job is finished less than 20 minutes and I don't need to recharge it for 2 - 3 usage. I guess the battery can be hold at test 1 hour with low speed setting.
customer_reviews.author: Jongkook

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Had an issue with it and when I called customer support, they immediately sent out a replacement part and it now works perfectly. Very powerful. I got the extra amperage battery (4.0) and it trims my whole .5 acre yd on a single charge.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This trimmer is nicer and works better than any gas powered unit I have purchased
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer is nicer and works better than any gas powered unit I have purchased. While I still give it a 5 star rating, the only drawback is the weight. It is pretty heavy and it is heavier than my Husqvarna trimmer. Also, if you are short (5' 5" or less), the trimmer may be long and more difficult to use. Additionally, it didn't use up a lot of the battery and I've been impressed with the GreenWorks line of products ... great mower, blower/vac and now this trimmer. Other than the blower/vac, battery life between charging has been great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great combo.
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying the Grass gator 4680 extra heavy duty trimmer head with steel blades will fit and work on this. This trimmer is great. Does not bogg down and keeps trimming for approximately an hour. Very well made. This works just as good as a gas powered trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: I will be very happy if all these units hold up for many years ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used several gas model trimmers over the years but I decided to try out the Greenworks since I already had the Greenworks pole saw which I saw very impressed with. Well I've used the trimmer for several months now and it's been flawless. I have 3 acres with a lot of trimming to be done, it takes 2 batteries to get it all done but I'm usually exhausted when I've finished. I looked all the reviews before purchasing to make sure it would get the job done. Since the trimmer purchase I've purchased the Greenworks hedger and the garden tiller also. I will be very happy if all these units hold up for many years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Hester

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase from start to finish
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I was looking for and could not find inhouse locally. It arrived well-packed in 2 days' time, and it works perfectly. What more can one ask?
customer_reviews.author: gi

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Battery lasts for about 2 hours of steady, but not continuous, use. No issues with power. It does what it's supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Steve B

customer_reviews.title: Handles existing attachments well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit so that I could use my existing Trimmer Plus attachments. Have so far used the blower and edger attachments with no problems. The battery-powered motor is not quite as powerful as my old gas-powered unit, but the convenience and ease-of-starting far outweighs the small loss of power. I'll not be going back to gas.
customer_reviews.author: Poor Richard

customer_reviews.title: Excellent weed trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I wish it had variable speed, but overall this works as good as my previous gas trimmer
customer_reviews.author: J. Gomez

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I like the trimmer in general. Packaging was poor but luckily everything seems to be working fine. I use it occasionally 20-30 minutes once a week but not every week and the battery has given me 2 uses before recharging. Good power, good line feed. Only con is the straight shaft which I find tough on my back but that is a problem with other straight shaft trimmers I have used.
customer_reviews.author: P. Krylowski

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: works great but a little heavy and not to easy to handle for me I guess my golden years dont help
customer_reviews.author: matt palmorino

customer_reviews.title: After having great luck with the Greenworks mower
customer_reviews.text: After having great luck with the Greenworks mower, I went for the trimmer - which uses the same battery. This is a great machine. My main issue with it (I read similar comments in other reviews) is the feeding of the string. Most trimmers - you can just tap the machine on the ground and the string will feed. This machine I had to do it manually. That is a design flaw that should be changed.
customer_reviews.author: djd66

customer_reviews.title: I love it. I had the 24 Volt trimmer before ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it uses the same battery as my GreenWorks lawnmower. I love it. I had the 24 Volt trimmer before this, but I wanted one with more power that could accept different attachments. I have been more than pleased with my purchase. This trimmer is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Cleverbacon

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic best purchase I've made in years
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic best purchase I've made in years. Just as powerful as gas 4amp battery lasts about one hour on low speed which is more than enough to cut through most grass and weeds.
customer_reviews.author: dta

customer_reviews.title: Good Enough for where I needed it!
customer_reviews.text: Only used it once so far. But It did pretty good as I expected. The only reason I did not give it 5 stars is because it didn't want to handle anything thicker than 1/4 inch thick. However, It handled just fine for where I wanted to trim the weeds & grass.
customer_reviews.author: Peter L poggi

customer_reviews.title: have not needed to use high power yet, I ...
customer_reviews.text: have not needed to use high power yet, I have a small 1/4 subdivision lot and trimmed evey thing quick and no messing with oil/gas and messing with it trying to start! This is quiet and solid, instant on and off!
customer_reviews.author: Chad W.

customer_reviews.title: Lasted less than a season
customer_reviews.text: Worked really well last fall- doesn't power up now. Disappointed with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: well built, trimmer with cool features.
customer_reviews.text: well built and powerful, on the heavy side but nice to have the power head out of dirt and debris, battery life about an hour on high power, has nice turbo feature when the going gets tough and does not wrap up weeds like other brand i tried, i have been using it with the de walt line which is awesome cause the line that comes with it is junk, the guard works great and i have no problem edging, it is critical to wind line the right direction or it will come off and bite you in legs, this is clearly indicated on spool, very happy over all.
customer_reviews.author: j b

customer_reviews.title: I like my trimmer
customer_reviews.text: The 4mh battery lasts for about an hour, enough for my purposes. It's a straight shaft machine and is just a little on the heavy side but I expected that and am happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: mike t

customer_reviews.title: Powerful & lightweight
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer is powerful, lightweight and runs over an hour on 1 fully charged battery. I have not found any downside to buying this. It has exceeded all my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: G. Middaugh

customer_reviews.title: We have around an acre and this works well.
customer_reviews.text: Very useful for our trimming. We have around an acre and this works well. I like the battery so much I bought more GreenWorks products. My only complaint is you can't buy pre-spun line for this specific product.
customer_reviews.author: JohnB

customer_reviews.title: Watch out oil companies this thing is great. I like not having to start it
customer_reviews.text: Watch out oil companies this thing is great. I like not having to start it, just push the on button and go to work. It's quite and charges fast. I get run times of around an hour on the standard battery.
customer_reviews.author: Jason L.

customer_reviews.title: Good power for homeowner trimming (I'm on an acre) and ...
customer_reviews.text: Good power for homeowner trimming (I'm on an acre) and the battery has lasted well over an hour of use for trimming and then more for the hedge trimmer on the same battery. No gas/fumes, no choke/starting/warm-up, no tune-ups BUT all the power instantly! Have the Hedge trimmer also and about to get the blower.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Trimmer works as advertised and battery lasts as long as I can.
customer_reviews.author: CGS

customer_reviews.title: It aint gas, No farting with mixing, starting ...
customer_reviews.text: It aint gas, No farting with mixing, starting, cussing. Charge battery, put in battery, turn on n GO. Works as well as my husqvarna 128 DJX, when I could get it running. Battery holds up to my acre+ lot
customer_reviews.author: Floyd Folk

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful and great battery life
customer_reviews.text: It exceeded my expectations. Very powerful and great battery life. It is a bit heavy but it comes with a shoulder strap. I'll never go back to a gas trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Glice

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Received in early December, but gave it a few tries anyhow. Very impressed. Worked better than the echo gas machine, and my arm did not fall off trying to start it. Easy, easy, easy.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Wright

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT, OTHER THAN
customer_reviews.text: I AM ELDERLY, CANNOT PULL GAS TRIMMERS ANY LONGER THAT DO NOT WANT TO START, MOST EXELENT PRODUCT, A BIT HEAVY THOUGH, LOVE IT, OTHER THAN WIEGHT
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Great Weedeater
customer_reviews.text: A little on the heavy side, but equal to a gas model
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hill

product_meta.title: Greenworks 14-Inch 40V Cordless String Trimmer (Attachment Capable), 4.0 AH Battery Included 21362
product_meta.description: Size:14-Inch| Style:4.0Ah Battery and ChargerWhether it's mowing your yard, or trimming the hedges, weeds and limbs or blowing away debris; GreenWorks Tools offer a complete yard work solution to get your yard work done for a professional landscaped look with its eco-fuel systems. From 20v, 24v to 40v lithium-ion battery platforms, you can now find the best lawn and garden system that will fit your needs in cost (Price), power and versatility. The DigiPro Brushless G-MAX Series provides the gas comparable power without the gas. Currently featuring the DigiPro 16" Chainsaw, DigiPro 185MPH Blower/Vac and now the 14" String Trimmer, you don't have to sacrifice power to go cordless. The DigiPro Brushless String Trimmer offers a 14" cut path with a .080 bump feed (head) to make it easy when advancing the line and cutting through tough weeds. The straight shaft design makes it easy to view your task without obstruction of view allowing you to work through your yard seamlessly. For versatility, the top mount motor head is detachable to offer multiple usage capabilities and is compatible with most gas attachments so that you don't have to purchase new proprietary tools (please see content above for more compatibility models). When looking for the right gas comparable lawn tools, GreenWorks G-MAX System is the right solution to turn to with the power and performance, longer run time and versatility to get the job done.
feature_bullets: Attachment capable, accepts most gas attachments to provide mulitple use
Brushless motor delivers greater torque, quieter operation and higher battery efficiency
Starts within seconds with gas comparable performance, battery compatible with multiple tools
Battery and Charger include. Compatible with battery models 29462 and 29472 and charger 29482
Compatible GreenWorks Replacement bulk string, Model 2906302

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars450 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
